campaign.story:
UPDATES
Sep 6th: UPDATE 6 - Second stretch goal REACHED!
Sep 1th: UPDATE 5 - First stretch goal reached!
Aug 25th: UPDATE 4 - NEW REWARDS!!!
Aug 20th: UPDATE 3 - Stretch goals revealed!
Aug 19th: UPDATE 2 - First goal reached, more to come!
Aug 10th: UPDATE 1 - Pledge Add-ons

Thanks to YOUR support, we have reached our base goal and have set up THREE NEW STRETCH GOALS!
 There are still many old-school filming techniques and practical effects we didn't use, primarily because nowadays, some of them are very rare, exotic and require special materials and tools. Techniques like matte paintings and rear projections would make „Slice of Life“ even more atmospheric and visually appealing, so it was always our wish to include them in our movie. If we reach this goal, that wish would become a reality! Plus, we would build even more more miniatures and that means a bigger, more vibrant cityscape!
 Our first stretch goal would enrich the visual appeal of the movie, and this one would add more drama and tension to its story. It is a scene that demands a brand new set, made from scratch, but it would be well worth it because that scene would give more gravitas to our main character and the struggle he has with himself, his nemesis and this damn city he's stuck in!

Even though „Slice of Life“ premiere will be held in Zagreb, Croatia, we always wanted to have another, international one. And what better place to do it than the center of film industry: Los Angeles. Not to mention that our movie is set in the streets and on the platforms of that same, albeit futuristic LA, so it would be kind of poetic! „Slice of Life“ on the big screen, in-depth and detailed film-makers show and tell and a chance to hang out with you guys (and a couple of cold ones)... yap, that would be a dream come through!
       When we started working on “Slice of Life”, we wanted to make an original movie set in a rather familiar world, and the biggest influence for us was clearly “Blade Runner”, as Ridley Scott, Jordan Cronenweth, and other movie legends envisioned it back in 1982.
Wet, foggy, and gritty streets of futuristic Los Angeles were a perfect place for our story, but we didn’t want to just copy/paste it and shoot a replica… We wanted to pay our tribute to “Blade Runner” in terms of aesthetics, and at the same time make “Slice of Life” something more than a mere fan-film or a sequel, with an unique storyline that doesn’t rely on anything seen in the “Blade Runner” universe.
That being said, “Slice of Life” is a tasteful homage to the masterpiece that inspired us on so many levels and we are honored if anyone can put our little movie in the same sentence as one of the greatest cinematic accomplishments of our time, but that is where the connections between these two movies end and our paths diverge. 
The duration of the short film will be approximately 20 minutes.
    Follow Slice Of Life on: Facebook | Twitter | Instagram
  It is just another damp, rainy, and foggy night on the streets of the futuristic Los Angeles. Beneath the flashy neon signs and heavy traffic, scum of this megalopolis tries to make a living and hopefully survive to see another day.
Criminals, junkies, prostitutes, punks… and one lonesome drug dealer in the middle of it all, fed up with this ever expanding city and lowlife parasites that inhabit it. He may be well on his way to leave it all behind, but fate has made other plans and his whole world will come crumbling down when a dirty cop with an agenda of his own enters his life.
  A big part of that 70s and 80s Sci-Fi allure comes from the use of practical special effects. Visionaries of that era relied on miniatures and models, animatronics, matte paintings, and other techniques for creation of those lavish imaginary worlds. Even today, 30 or 40 years later, the charm and depth of their work remains unparalleled. We are not against CGI and other modern era tools (we use it heavily in our commercial work), but in order to pay a worthy homage to our predecessors, we wanted to make “Slice of Life” as authentic as we could.
So, everything you see in our trailer and will see in the completed movie is made the “old-school” way.
We learned to build miniatures, light them properly, learned how to create practical effects, so that we could film everything in camera like people did back in the 80s. We filmed on real sets that we built from scratch for “Slice of Life”. All of the miniatures and real-sized sets were created from cheap materials, junk, computer parts, and lots of imagination.
Building the "car set":
Old Citroën BX 1986 bought for the production
    Finished car interior
 Building the miniature car for exterior scenes:
Miniature car model
    We have spent the last three years in a garage, taking every spare moment of our time and all of our skill, dedicating it to bringing “Slice of Life” to… well, life.
Our core team consists of only three people, and with some help of our friends and family, we carried this project on our backs for as long as we could, but we realized that, in order to finish our movie in the way we envisioned it, we need the help from our fans and the wider community. As a platform best suited for our needs, we chose Kickstarter to present this movie, connect us with our audience, and give you a chance to be an essential part in the creation of “Slice of Life”.
Filming the miniature city
  Filming the car interior
    We need you guys to help us finish the movie. A big part of the movie is shot, but we have an extensive miniature shoot ahead of us and a complicated post-production process.
For the miniature shoot we need better equipment like new lenses and additional lighting, and a professional motion control system (because everything will be shot in passes*).
*Shooting in passes - a complicated and slow process of shooting the same shot multiple times in different lighting conditions, the same way it was done in the 80's.
There’s also lots of additional miniature building which is very time consuming so we need to put our daily commercial work on hold.
Unpainted building made from junk / Finished miniature building
The cherry on top will be the soundtrack. Vangelis is infiltrated in our minds and souls, so we have a pretty big mountain to climb. Help us, and together we’ll put our “Slice of Life” flag on top of it!
  First and foremost, you get our deepest gratitude, not just for helping us financially, but for believing in us and our project. We want to thank you for your support and trust, and give you something to remember "Slice of Life" as one of your fondest memories in the years to come.
That being said, we prepared lots of cool “Slice of Life” props, T-shirts, special “Slice of Life” collectors’ boxes and a beautiful movie soundtrack, exclusively pressed on vinyl. Of course, there will be one more thing - this finished short film called “Slice of Life”, which you will be able to enjoy for a very long time in the years to come.
    Limited edition police badge, cast from the production molds
    This cute spaceship is looking for a new home!
  With less than 2 weeks to go, we’ve decided to stir things up a bit and offer you something really special: two new awesome and unique rewards!
It’s the one that our character drives throughout the whole movie and basically is a character of its own. This is not just a screen used model or fun looking prop that would look nice on your shelf, it is a true piece of craftsmanship, and a piece of our film’s history.
We’ll create a unique 15-second retro sci-fi commercial for your business, that will be featured in “Slice of Life” as one of the commercials projected on those huge building screens for 5 seconds. And now the best part, you’ll get full copyright for the 15-second commercial to use it in real life promotion for your company! Show the ad to the world on your web site, social media, YouTube, TV etc.!
 You like our reward tiers and want to contribute, but feel like you’re missing out on something? Don’t worry, we’ve got you covered! With this add-on system, you can build your own perfect reward package and enjoy full “Slice of Life” experience with all of the items you want. There are NO LIMITATIONS to the number of add-ons you can get: all you have to do is choose an amount to add to your pledge and answer a survey at the end of the campaign regarding the items you want. You can choose from the following list of items and follow the instructions bellow: 
*included in every Blu-ray/DVD Set of "Slice of Life"
 To add an add-on to your pledge, follow these steps:
1. Press the “Back this Project” button above. If you’ve already pledged, it will say “Manage Your Pledge”.
2. Choose a reward you are interested in and increase your pledge in the “Pledge Amount” box by the amount (in US dollars) of item or items you want to add. (There are no limitations to the number of items you can add.)
3. We’ll send you a survey after the end of the Kickstarter campaign regarding the add-ons you chose.
After we have launched our trailer, we had great luck to be picked up by many esteemed international publications like “The Verge”, “io9 Gizmodo”, “Huffington Post” and movie fan sites like “Jo Blo”.
We appreciate all the help that we have managed to get so far. But now, the time has come to make our biggest and final step: KICKSTARTER.
So if you are a member of the media and you would like to help a few hardcore movie lovers that are trying to make something special from their garage by covering our story or arranging an interview – please, contact us at relax@sliceoflifefilm.com
Any help with spreading the word around would be AWESOME. Please share our story with anyone you think might appreciate the project. It would mean the world to us. Also, you can share our campaign through the "Share" button at the top. Sharing is caring!
The Verge article : https://www.theverge.com/2017/1/29/14430964/blade-runner-croatian-filmmakers-fanfilm
io9 article: http://io9.gizmodo.com/this-blade-runner-fan-film-looks-absolutely-gorgeous-1791789192
 If you're hooked and can't wait to see the finished "Slice of Life" film in all it's glory with tons of bonus features don't fall into despair! As we said most of "Slice of life" was filmed over the span of 3 years. So here's your chance to watch the painfully beautiful journey of making the film in our garage. Witness how we managed to survive an ant invasion, film through the biggest croatian heat wave in the last 50 years and learn all about "spiderweb transplantation". Plus, listen to some cool blues while watching this fun and epic featurette series.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
“Slice of Life” is a massive project, and if we take in consideration all of the facts (small crew, heavy use of practical effects, insufficient time and funds to fully commit to it), we have done a pretty good job in the last three years.

Most of the principal shooting is completed, so the film will come out one way or another, but we don’t want it to be just another short sci-fi movie that you scour through and forget about 20 minutes after you had watched it. We want to make “Slice of Life” an unforgettable experience for fans of the genre and also for those who don’t really know that much about it, and to pay a truly worthy tribute to the classics that kept inspiring us for so many years.

We hope that we are not alone in this and that you share our love and admiration of those classics (and movies in general), and we welcome you to join us on our adventure.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Yo guys!
Well, it seems 2020 isn't turning out to be quite as we expected for all of us. Instead of enjoying the  summer in sexy speedos and banana hammocks, we have to deal with face masks, social distancing and other small "delights" this pandemic brought us.
Fortunately,  there is some good news! As you read this update, postal services across the world are  shipping first packages of "Slice of Life" rewards. Initial round are rewards containing only DVD/Blu-ray and/or T-Shirt perks, and depending  on what continent you are on and what COVID protocol your country has,  you should be getting your packages any day now.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE 22 - THIS HOLIDAY SEASON, SLICE OF LIFE IS COMING TO YOUR HOME!
updates.update_content:
Ho ho ho!!!! Merry Christmas!!!!

Our dear friend Santa told us that this year all of you were exceptionally good, so we prepared a very special Christmas present. After all, your support kept us going and was one of the crucial things that made “Slice of Life” possible. You showed great patience and understanding while we brought this project to the finish line. So now, when the movie is completed, it’s time for you to finally see it!

Without further ado and with a faint drum roll in the background, we proudly present “”! All you have to do is check your e-mail inbox where you’ll find a secure link to the movie, and hopefully enjoy watching it as much as we did making it. As promised, this is a definite director’s cut version of the movie, and you’ll be the first ones to watch it the way we always intended it to be.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE 21 - SLICE OF LIFE GO AMERICAS
updates.update_content:
YO GUYS!
Well, the summer is coming to an end, so it's time to fill you in with some new information about "Slice of Life".
First thing first, for all of you who are dying to see the movie and can't wait for your perks to arrive, we are still on the track. It won't be long till it's all done and ready to be shipped. The vinyl and the book are prepared and need only to be printed, and we are currently working on the documentaries, so our epic journey really is coming to its end. And again, thank you all for the patience and love you gave us!

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE 20 - SLICE OF LIFE L.A. PREMIERE
updates.update_content:
YO! It's time for our big summer update!
We have some great news to share with you, but first thing first, we want to address all of the questions regarding the release of the movie and your perks. As you already know from our previous update, we are currently on the festival circuit with a shorter version of "Slice of Life", and we believe that this festival cycle will be over in the next couple of months. It's same with the perks, as we need to finish documentaries, books, posters, vinyl, boxes and everything else you pledged for.

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE 19 - SLICE OF LIFE IN TOKYO!

updates.update_content:
Yippee ki-yay!!!
How are you guys??? Chillin' during the Holidays??
Here's some info from the Slice of Life headquarters. As we said, sound and music mix on Slice of Life is almost finished. The big news for us is that very soon we'll head to Berlin, Germany to do a professional 'Color grading'. That's gonna give our movie that little extra something to make it just the way we envisioned it.

Howdy!
We're back today with a brand new Production diary!
The movie is edited, and for the past few months we've been working hard on sound design and the soundtrack.
We didn't record absolutely any sound during filming. It was too complicated because of the on and off filming we did, and we actually decided that since we don't have dialogue we don't even need to bother. The plan was to recreate all the sounds in the studio with the help of our friend Ivan Mihoci. And that's actually totally OK. Even if we recorded sound we would probably re-record and replace a lot of it to get specific sounds that we wanted.

YOOOO everybody!!

So we have been very busy. We finished filming all the miniature work and now we can show you the latest Production Diary.. what number are we up to? ahhh yes 14!! WOW!
YO!!!

Yo everybody!!!
That's right, we can safely say we finished the filming of ALL scenes with the actors. (For real this time, I know we had about seven wrap parties so far but nobody needs to know about that...)
The last scene we filmed was the mysterious NIGHTCLUB SCENE. I can't say anything about it except giving you a small teaser:

campaign.story:
Hello!
I'm Adam, a British graphic design student and games enthusiast. I am proud to share with you my Kickstarter project: NOVA, a simple but classy playing card concept.
For the past two months I've been behind the keyboard and mouse, creating this deck. What started as a few scribbles and ideas quickly became a full-scale project and now I'm ready to bring the deck to life with the help of Kickstarter!
The original inspiration for this deck came from a notebook I bought a few years back; I thought the cover would look great on a deck of cards and so I ran with the idea and the result was NOVA. 
Printed by NPCC on quality card stock, NOVA is a fully custom designed deck of 54 playing cards featuring geometric designs with custom pips. Each card will have a linen finish and NPCC's special coating to give the best durability and slipping effect.
Design Details
  The Spade Court Cards
  The Heart Court Cards
  The Diamond Court Cards
  The Club Court Cards
  The Aces
  A selection of other designs including new back design (top left)
 Note: all designs are subject to change.
Each deck will come packaged in a custom designed tuck box. The box will feature a matte finish with gold foil for an extra flair of elegance.
The Tuck Box Design
    At £6,000 the sandy coloured lines on the cards will all be printed with metallic inks to add a stylish finish to the deck.
At £8,000 the inside of the tuck box will be embellished with a custom foiled design. This addition will give an extra touch of class to the NOVA deck.
  At £10,000 the deck will include a double-backer and a blank face card for performing magic tricks.
Stay tuned: there may be more stretch goals to come!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I am fully dedicated to ensuring that each and every backer is satisfied with the product they receive. All designs are complete (however, slight changes may be made) so the printing will commence shortly after the funding period ends and I hope to have all decks shipped in time for the holidays. Shipping will be managed by NPCC's fulfilment service and delivery will be tracked.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Air Deck -  The ultimate travel playing cards
Our mission is to create the ultimate playing cards for travelers.
Check out our website HERE
Check us out on Facebook HERE
By travelers for travelers: 
The idea for this project was conceived by fellow globetrotters Ursus Negenborn and Rune Kippervik while traveling South East Asia. We love playing cards, but we couldn’t really find anything that was quite suited for our minimalist way of traveling. When you travel as much as we do, you don’t want to carry anything extra around. Every item makes a difference. We’re big fans of improvement, and decided to create the ultimate playing cards for travelers. The making of the Air Deck has taken us through several countries, and we’ve met many wonderful people along the way. Now we have the prototype ready and we’re proud of the result. Meet our new travel companion, the Air Deck. The world's first truly travel optimized playing cards!
The Air Deck team
Key Features:
52 Playing Cards + 2 jokers
Waterproof and washable
Premium printing with a protective matte varnish
Made from extra durable premium PVC
Slightly textured back, smooth front 
Sturdy deluxe matte tuck box 
Playing card size : 3.43 x 1.26 inches (87 x 32mm)
Perks:
Free world-wide shipping
Free PDF “Card games from around the world”
Option to buy the Air Deck in white color
Here's a mock-up of how the Air Deck will look in red color.
  With the Air Deck with you can play everywhere anytime. It fits easily on small surfaces, such as a plane tray table.
  Regular paper playing cards tear, stain, bend and break easily, but we've designed the Air Deck to be extremely durable.
Quality
While we wanted a compact and light deck, we didn't want to compromise on quality. We went to several of the world’s manufacturers of premium casino cards and asked for the best materials they could provide. In the process of creating the ultimate travel deck, we tried out over 50 different high end plastic materials. The materials were taken through  scratch, bending and handling tests to identify the best candidate. Finally we ended up with a premium ‘casino quality’ PVC that has all the properties we want.
The cards have a premium feel to them.
  The Air Deck is designed to be brought anywhere. It takes up very little space and easily fits into your pocket.
The Air Deck is incredibly resistant to tearing and bending, and it’s totally waterproof. You can play with these in the pool, in the boat, in the tub, in the rain, at the beach, pretty much wherever you can think of.
The cards are 100% waterproof, so you can even use them in the pool or the bathtub.
  The cards are washable. Liquids and dust rinse off easily.
  The Air Deck is a surefire convesation starter.
Handling
In the process of selecting the material we sought advice from several playing card professionals, to help us find the optimal material and design. The end result a deck that shuffles and handles like you expect professional cards to do. The cards are slightly textured on the back, while the front is plain. This provides excellent handling and a good grip.
The Air Deck shuffles easily
  Our goal was to make the Air Deck both visually interesting and simple to read.
Design
We’ve worked hard to create a fitting minimalist design for the Air Deck. For us, it was key that the cards are uncluttered, symmetrical and easy to read. We also wanted to create something fun and ‘out-of-the- ordinary’. The Air Deck’s unique design will no doubt act as a conversation starter on your travels. The deck consists of 52 playing cards + 2 jokers and measures 87mm X 32mm. Despite the smaller footprint we’ve retained all the features of standard decks. The length ensures that it handles much like a full size deck, and the narrower width makes the deck fit nicely in the palm of your hands.
Jack, queen, king and ace of hearts.
  The Air Deck comes with a solid tuck box. It's laminated for extra protection and features spot UV printing.
 For this campaign we’re offering the cards in two different colors; black and white.
The Air Deck in black color
  The Air Deck in white color.
  The Air Deck in red color
We hope that you are as excited about the Air Deck as we are. Support our project, and give yourself, or someone you care about, the perfect playing cards for traveling.
Add a nice view to your game.
  The Air Deck is incredibly strong and flexible.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We do not anticipate any major challenges to this project, and we promise to stay transparent and update you every step of the way. 

Much of the work is already done. The design phase of the cards is finalized and we’ve made the prototype you see in the video. We’ve had personal meetings with the manufacturer and agreed on all details, and we've gotten several quotes for fulfillment and shipping from reliable partners. We're ready to go! :) 

Now we just need your support so that we can afford to print the first batch of decks.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The card deck for Left-Handed Players
10% of the population is left-handed. The common card deck is right-handed. So it goes. Over the years, there have been left-handed decks, but not a single one has celebrated the many famous lefties of the world. A missed opportunity in our book. With the Sinister Deck, we set out to bring lefties and righties alike a deck that's unique, a little bit educational, and plenty of good fun.
What makes our deck special?
Contains 54 custom, hand-illustrated cards by Michael White
18 "face cards" featuring famous Left-Handed people (16 Ace-Jack + 2 Jokers)
Each suit is a different theme: Hearts are Musicians, Spades are Historical Figures, Clubs are Politicians, and Diamonds are Film/TV Personalities
Our deck is "Left-handed": Card Indicators are on the opposite sides so you can fan the cards "left-handed"
Special Details: We added a few subtle touches to the designs that die-hard fans will notice.  We also retained traditional deck details like the "suicidal king" and "one eyed jacks". 
UPDATE:
GUEST ARTIST: We have brought on the insanely talented (and left-handed) Danny Beck to draw a bonus card that will be included in the deck. Check out his art if you don't already know him and give that feller a follow. We're super excited to see what he comes up with.
STRETCH GOAL: $25k unlocks 20 additional lefties featured on the 6-10 number cards in monochrome 
BONUS: All Rewards above $100 get a free deck of cards.  
All Reward levels will have the chance to add on extra items via BackerClub
Card Illustrations
Joan of Arc prototype as one of the number cards for our stretch goal
The Lefties
When we started this project, we had no idea how hard it would be to narrow down the ranks of left-handed visionaries to 18 people. The more we looked, the more qualified lefties we found. Our working list is below.
Wilds/Jokers:
Nietzsche
Marie Curie
Spades (historical figures):
ACE - Neil Armstrong/Buzz Aldrin
KING - Leonardo Da Vinci
QUEEN - Helen Keller
JACK - Mark Twain
6-10 number cards - TBD for stretch goal
Clubs (politicians):
ACE - Barack Obama
KING - Julius Caesar
QUEEN - Ruth Bader Ginsburg
JACK - Fidel Castro
6-10 number cards - TBD for stretch goal
Hearts (musicians):
ACE - Mozart
KING - David Bowie
QUEEN - Lady Gaga
JACK - Paul McCartney
6-10 number cards - TBD for stretch goal
Diamonds (film):
ACE - Diane Keaton
KING - Kermit The Frog
QUEEN - Oprah
JACK - Charlie Chaplin
6-10 number cards - TBD for stretch goal
Card Prototypes
Each card is hand illustrated, featuring famous left-hand musicians, actors, and historical figures.
We moved the card indicators to the opposite side so you can fan the cards "left-handed".
 Card Specs & Details
Standard Playing Size: Our cards will be standard playing card dimensions: 2.5" x 3.5".
Box: Each deck will live in a custom tuck box for safekeeping.
Quality: Our cards will be printed on the highest quality cardstock available. 
Shipping: We've added shipping options for each of our rewards and have included the shipping on the basic deck rewards to keep the pricing simple. 
Card "tuck box" prototype
This nifty t-shirt is one of our reward options
Who We Are
Tiger is a left-handed creative living in Echo Park, Los Angeles with his three cats, Cat Stevens, Ziggy Purrdust and Chauncey Gardener.  He has a dozen years of experience in product management.  In his free time, he creates music and hosts game nights.  He also founded the cat clothing / charity brand The Future Is Feline. 
Michael is a full-time illustrator and Scenic Artist living in Highland Park, Los Angeles.  He has successfully launched the "Little Hipsters” book Kickstarter Project.  On certain weekends, you can find him in Joshua Tree playing Settlers of Catan. 
The boys in the war room

updates.update_userinfo: ChippyWand = golf x bocce x wiffle ball ..... finally launched!
updates.update_content:
Hey lefties & friends of lefties!  My friend, Mac, just launched a kickstarter for his new yard game, perfect for summer, called "ChippyWand".  
If you like bocce, wiffle ball, golf, or just fun games you can play outside with friends, this is for you. 
He's even working on a stretch goal for a left-handed club soon. It would mean alot to him if you could check out the project and share it: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/chippywandgolfgame/chippywand-golf-game

Hey lefties and friends,
We have started shipping orders.  You will be receiving an email from us via BackerKit with your tracking numbers once your order has shipped.  We are starting with the simple orders and working our way up.  We are trying our best to get out the orders as fast as possible—thanks for being patient.  If you ordered a poster, those will be shipped separately from the rest of your order.

updates.update_userinfo: "First Look" at the final The Sinister Deck // Remember to Complete your Surveys
updates.update_content:
We just got the sample deck in today, shrink-wrapped and everything.  We are very pleased with the quality (see vid below!) and can't wait to get the rest of the decks from the printer to ship to yall.
If you haven't done so already, please complete the Backerkit survey.  If you don't have an email from Backerkit, you can go to this link to get your survey: https://sinisterdeck.backerkit.com/

updates.update_userinfo: BackerKit surveys should be in your inbox. Happy International Left-Handers Day!
updates.update_content:
BackerKit surveys are coming!
Soon, you’ll receive an email from us with a special link to your BackerKit survey. It’s important to respond to your survey as quickly as you can since we need this information to fulfill your rewards.  You can also add on additional decks or other products (like these nifty pins shown below). 
You don’t need to create a BackerKit account to fill out your survey. When you receive the email with the survey, click the survey link to respond. Answer the questions about your reward preferences, provide shipping information, and purchase add-on items if you like. You don’t have access to this survey link yet, but it will be available soon via email!

We're ready!
Tiger & I have been busting our butts in the last few weeks both on our "day jobs" and working to get this finished and ready for print. And I'm happy to say, we are there. The art is complete (with the exception of some final editing and decision making), but we are prepping all of the files for the printer. We are still expecting the rewards to be ready on time and plenty of time before holiday shopping.

We are officially funded!  Thanks for all the support, sharing and feedback.
Michael and I chatted and decided that even tho we didn't hit the stretch goal, we are super excited to add in additional left-handed characters.
Here's what's next:

updates.update_userinfo: You did it! Now onto Sinister Deck production...
updates.update_content:
Hey, everyone! Your friendly neighborhood artist, Michael here with one more update. 
You all are the best and I'm so happy that you're on this journey with us and making this card deck happen. It's been one of the most fun illustration projects I've ever done and it gets better every day. I've been drawing constantly over the last several weeks getting the remaining artwork finished and even getting into character illustrations for the number cards in anticipation of our stretch goal. We really want to make all of these and I think we will be pushing that stretch to a lower number as an excuse to do it.Your feedback and suggestions have been an incredible aid in making this the best deck we can make - THANK YOU!!

campaign.story:
Final Stretch Goal: $125,000 for interactive experiences
Once again, the generosity of the community of Jim Henson fans has surpassed our wildest expectations! Thanks to all of you who helped us reach our stretch goal of $100,000 to support the conservation of puppets in the Museum’s Jim Henson Collection.  
For the remainder of our Kickstarter campaign, we invite you to help support the production of the two interactive experiences in The Jim Henson Exhibition as we strive for a second and final stretch goal of $125,000. These interactive experiences are key ingredients in the exhibition, and with additional funding, we can build them as imagined. They demonstrate two of Henson’s most significant innovations: puppetry for the television screen and puppet character design.  
“Perform a Puppet on Screen” gives visitors an opportunity to experience first-hand what it is like to watch themselves perform a puppet on a television monitor. When they’re finished, they will be able to email a video of their performance to themselves. 
The “Design an Anything Muppet Character” experience begins with a short video featuring Henson puppet-builder Rollie Krewson demonstrating how she designs “Anything Muppet” characters for Sesame Street. Visitors will be able to select facial features and accessories for an “Anything Muppet” form, and see what their character looks like on screen.  
These two interactive experiences will allow visitors to get creative and discover their inner character designer and puppeteer!
Stretch Goal: $100,000 to restore more puppets!
We are so grateful for the outpouring of support from the community of Jim Henson fans! Your generosity has enabled us to meet our goal of $40,000 to preserve and install the puppets in The Jim Henson Exhibition in just two days!
We hope you will continue to support us and help us spread the word about this campaign, as we extend our efforts to preserve Jim’s legacy: we are setting a new goal of $100,000, which will help us restore more puppets in the Museum’s Jim Henson collection. The Jim Henson Exhibition at MoMI and its traveling version, The Jim Henson Exhibition: Imagination Unlimited, will feature many of Jim’s unique puppets, but there are many more “waiting in the wings” for their turn! As The Jim Henson Exhibition is a permanent exhibition at the Museum, the puppets in the original installation will rotate off at times for routine conservation, and it is imperative that other puppets be ready to take their place!
The Museum’s Jim Henson collection includes puppets from all of Jim’s work for film and television. To name just a few: 
Kermit the Frog, Miss Piggy, Scooter, Dr. Bunsen Honeydew, Rowlf, Beaker, Gonzo, Zoot, the Swedish Chef, the Koozebanians, and Camilla from The Muppet Show; 
Big Bird, Elmo, Count von Count, Grover, Cookie Monster, Prairie Dawn, Ernie and Bert from Sesame Street; 
Junior Gorg, Doozers, and all the Fraggles from Fraggle Rock; 
Jen, Kira, Aughra, Pod people and a Skeksis and Mystic from The Dark Crystal; 
Rare puppets from Jim’s television commercials and other early work in the 1950s and 1960s, including Yorick from Sam and Friends, the LaChoy Dragon, Wilkins and Wontkins, Sir Linit, Taminella Grinderfall, the “Java” puppets, and the Tastee Freeze Boss; 
Puppets from Emmet Otter’s Jugband Christmas, The Muppet Musicians of Bremen, Faffner Hall, and much more! 
We cannot thank you enough for your overwhelming support. We are thrilled to be working with you all to preserve this unique and important collection for generations to come.
With a generous gift of hundreds of puppets and artifacts from the Henson family, Museum of the Moving Image in New York City plans to open a brand new, permanent exhibition dedicated to the work of legendary puppeteer and director Jim Henson. Over the course of a singular career, Henson created stories and characters for television and film that have delighted and inspired generations of fans around the world — from the glamorous Miss Piggy and the gentle Grover, to the mystical creatures of The Dark Crystal. The Jim Henson Exhibition will share the full story of Henson’s unique talent, and the deeply collaborative creative process behind his work.
What will the exhibition include?
The exhibition will feature more than 40 original puppets — including Kermit the Frog, Miss Piggy, Elmo, Cookie Monster, the Fraggles, and a Skeksis from The Dark Crystal — as well as puppet prototypes, original character sketches, rare behind-the-scenes footage and photographs, and interactive puppetry design and performance experiences.
Sections of the exhibition will be devoted to:
Henson’s early work for television and film in the 1950s and 60s, in which his unbridled imagination, wit, and capacity for creative innovation were clearly established 
Sesame Street, where his remarkably expressive puppets have delighted children for generations 
The Muppet Show and Muppet feature films, which have had an indelible impact on popular culture 
and the imaginary worlds of Fraggle Rock, The Dark Crystal, and Labyrinth
Preserving the puppets for future generations
The Jim Henson Collection at Museum of the Moving Image includes approximately 175 historic puppets, such as Kermit the Frog, Miss Piggy, Big Bird, Ernie, Bert, Elmo, the Fraggles, Jen and Kira from The Dark Crystal, and many, many more. The restoration of this important collection is an ongoing collaboration between the Museum and Jim Henson’s Creature Shop, with input from fine art conservators. The Museum is honored to be working with the designers and builders at the legendary Creature Shop to restore and preserve the puppets for future generations.
About the traveling exhibition
The Museum is excited to launch a traveling version of the exhibition, The Jim Henson Exhibition: Imagination Unlimited, which will tour around the country and the world! The tour kicks off at Seattle’s Museum of Pop Culture on May 20, 2017. We are thrilled that the flagship and traveling versions of the exhibition will reach such a large, diverse audience.
About the screenings and public programs 
The Museum is already a busy hub of Henson-related activity and programming: we host monthly screenings of Henson’s work that draw a large, enthusiastic audience, and we have piloted an engaging slate of education and family programs related to the exhibition, which will serve school groups and families all year long.
Why Kickstarter? 
The lasting, universal appeal of Henson’s work is unprecedented. People of all ages continue to be delighted and inspired by Jim Henson’s stories and characters. We’re excited to use Kickstarter to connect with Henson fans around the world, and bring this global community together to support a permanent exhibition honoring his creative legacy.
What will your contributions support? 
The City of New York awarded the Museum a generous grant that has enabled us to build the gallery in which this important and inspiring exhibition will be housed. Construction of the gallery space is complete and plans for the exhibition have been finalized.

But we need your support to bring the rest of this incredible exhibition to life, in time for the 2017 school year. Your pledges will help us complete the important work of restoring the puppets in the Museum’s Henson Collection and fabricating and installing the display cases for the puppets and other artifacts. 
Your contributions will ensure that hundreds of thousands of visitors from around the world will be inspired by the creative process behind Jim Henson’s work, and be able to get up close and personal with such beloved puppet characters as Kermit the Frog, Miss Piggy, Elmo, Big Bird, the Fraggles, and many more.
Rewards
Video credits  
Video production by Slam! Media Group 
 Producer: Glen Hoffman 
 Camera: Peter Trilling, Stas Bilyavskiy 
 Audio: Evan Manners, Jordan Moser 
 Editing: Neil Miller, Thomas Dexter 
 Music: Elias
Special thanks to the estate of Jack L. Hiller for permission to use his photographs.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If our funding goal is not met, it is likely that The Jim Henson Exhibition will not open in summer 2017, which is our target date. Once we have the necessary funds in hand, there is nothing that stands in our way of bringing The Jim Henson Exhibition to life!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Each set, available in editions of 100, is numbered and embossed with the Jim Henson Archives seal, and will come in a portfolio with a personal letter from Brian Henson and documentation from Jim Henson archivist Karen Falk.
The dimensions of the three pieces in the set are as follows:
Hilarity: Image 7" x 15.2", Paper 13.1" x 21.4"
Melancholy: Image 17” x 6.9”, Paper 23” x 13.1”
Conceit: Image 14.3” x 9.2”, Paper 20.3” x 15.5”

support.title: Four packs of Farscape in motion cards
support.descp:
Only true Jim Henson fans know that The Jim Henson Company co-produced Farscape, a sci-fi television series that ran from 1999 to 2003. The Jim Henson Company was responsible for the various alien make-up designs and prostheses, and two regular characters (the animatronic puppets Rygel and Pilot) are Creature Shop creations. This reward includes four 4-packs of Farscape in motion lenticular cards (16 cards total). Some card packs include a “from the archives” costume card, a sound in motion audio card, or a hand-numbered archive collection cards.
INCLUDES:
Four 4-packs of Farscape in motion lenticular cards
Exclusive behind-the-scenes updates
Your name on the Museum’s Website

updates.update_userinfo: A rare evening with Frank Oz on September 22 (discount enclosed)
updates.update_content: An Evening with Frank Oz

Dear Henson Kickstarter Backers,
We are working hard to complete the exhibition for the opening next week!!! We are also shipping rewards every week, and notifications are going out as those packages are being mailed. Thank you for your patience with us as we go through rewards for over 2,000 backers!
Please note that the exhibition opens to the public on July 22. On July 21, we have our Kickstarter Day. An invitation was emailed a few weeks ago. If for some reason you missed the opening invitation, please message us and we will coordinate this with you directly.

updates.update_userinfo: A message from The Jim Henson Exhibition Curator
updates.update_content:
Thank you for your understanding and patience as we worked through some technical issues associated with our Kickstarter webpage acknowledging the names of all our amazing Kickstarter Campaign backers for The Jim Henson Exhibition. The page is back up and can be accessed here, where you will see your name among a long list of fellow Henson fans!
For those backers who have not filled out our survey yet, as soon as you do so, we will add your names to the list.

updates.update_userinfo: Backer Acknowledgment page is back up!
updates.update_content:
We are excited to announce that the long-awaited The Jim Henson Exhibition opens Saturday, July 22, thanks in large part to all of your support!  
This dynamic visitor experience—housed in a new gallery space funded by the City of New York—explores Henson’s groundbreaking work for film and television and his transformative impact on popular culture. The exhibition features a broad range of artifacts from throughout his remarkable television and film career, and reveals how Henson and his team of builders, performers, and writers brought to life the enduringly popular worlds of , , , , and . It also includes material from Henson’s lesser known and experimental film projects, presenting Henson as a restlessly creative performer, filmmaker, and technical innovator.

Our Kickstarter campaign for The Jim Henson Exhibition has come to a close. In total, we raised $144,230 pledged by 2,072 generous and enthusiastic backers. We at the Museum of the Moving Image cannot even begin to express the gratitude we feel for the overwhelming support this project has received. It has been extremely heartwarming to interact with the global community of Henson fans, and we look forward to meeting many of you once the exhibit opens at the Museum! Stay tuned, an opening date will be announced shortly.

updates.update_userinfo: The Jim Henson Exhibition opens July 22!
updates.update_content: With just 24 hours remaining, our campaign has exceeded $140,000 in pledges and surpassed 2,000 backers. We are blown away by these tremendous milestones and the support we have received. We cannot thank you enough!

project_data.project_name: The Jim Henson Exhibition at Museum of the Moving Image

campaign.story:
Studying a craft and learning the disciplines needed to execute an art takes time. Fine tuning details that have defined a genre. Developing new techniques while maintaining its integrity. What has been created is the result of the time it takes to create something classic but new. Something unique but familiar. Gamblers Warehouse in collaboration with Pablo from 4pm Designs is proud to present the beginning of our Masterclass. 
Master Class Black
  Master Class White
Developing a new style to the already well known Tally-Ho brand. Incorporating minor elements from the original Tally-Ho releases and presenting a respectable design that elevates the art of playing cards.
Deck Features:  
- 56 fully custom playing cards  
- Matte finish tuck box  
- Silver foil printing on box  
- Silver foil stamp seal  
- 2 Jokers  
- 2 Gaff cards
- Chrome Black Edition Limited to 2500 decks
- Chrome White Edition Limited to 1000 decks
Chrome White Limited Edition Tuck

campaign.story:
Stay up to date with the film at www.bazanfilm.com 
photo credit: Ryan Russell
    DAVE BAZAN rose to fame in the late 90s with his band, PEDRO THE LION. They were popular on the indie rock circuit and paved the way for artists like Sufjan Stevens and Mumford & Sons, making well-respected music that didn't shy away from themes of faith. The band’s sales and notoriety increased steadily throughout the early 2000s. But in 2006 Dave entered a time of deep personal introspection and began peeling back the layers of his beliefs. Initially he thought the process would lead him closer to the Christian God he believed in. Instead, HIS FAITH BEGAN TO COMPLETELY UNRAVEL, leading to the breakup of his band, a massive bout of writer’s block, and a drinking problem. The onset of this dark season was publicly punctuated with a Washington Post article titled “Hallelujah Palooza” where Dave was described as having “already blown through a gallon jug of water mixed with Vodka” at the strictly dry Cornerstone Christian Music Festival. 
The mixture of NEWFOUND MEANINGLESSNESS AND ALCOHOL was a dangerous combination as he torched relationships, alienated his audience, and found himself unable to write new music. In losing his band. Dave lost his sole means of providing for his family of four. To maintain their bottom line, he was forced to strip down his touring method. Without a stage or even amplification, he began playing secondary and tertiary markets, performing literally in people’s living rooms. He toured the country, driving alone for weeks at a time. In that solitude he WRESTLED WITH ALL HIS IDEAS ABOUT GOD, and finally left the Christian faith.
In the years since, Dave has been reconstructing his worldview from the ground up. Trying to figure out WHAT THE HELL HAPPENED? And what does it mean for his work, his family, and society as a whole. And since we believe these are some of the most important questions one can ask, WE DECIDED TO MAKE A DOCUMENTARY ABOUT IT.
  THE FILM
We’ve been following Dave for two years. Riding in the van across the country, shooting in living rooms and rock clubs and having deep talks with Dave and the people who cross his path. And it has been a beautiful and fascinating journey. From the release of his 2016 album BLANCO through the creation and release of CARE (launching simultaneously with the Kickstarter.) we've been there for the ups and downs of Dave's life on the road as a working class musician. What we have is a stunning film about ART, FAITH, AND THE COURAGE TO BREAK RANKS IN SEARCH OF TRUTH. The footage we've captured, along with Dave’s 20 year body of work give the audience a front row seat to the heartbreakingly intimate process of a man losing his faith, his worldview, and slogging eyes open through the stages of grief.
THIS IS A FILM FOR OUR TIMES. While the subject is a musician, this is not a tour documentary, a fan film, or a music doc in the traditional sense. It is instead an exploration of modern American spirituality viewed through the lens of an EXTRAORDINARY ARTIST GRAPPLING WITH HIS PERSONAL FAITH. And now is the perfect time for a film dealing with these questions. When we as a nation are struggling with our very identity, defining what is real, and what matters to us going forward. CHRISTIANITY IS AT THE CRUX OF THE DIVIDE IN AMERICA and Dave is one of the rare voices who is able to speak to both sides. His critically acclaimed record “Curse Your Branches”, was called his “break up record with God” by the biggest music journalists, but also somehow found its way onto the list of the Top Ten albums of the year by the massively influential, Christianity Today. Dave's living room shows, featuring no holds barred Q&A sessions, give us an incredibly rare look into the earnest discussions about faith and politics happening in small cities across the country. 
We are making this film without an agenda beyond exploring the fascinating story of one man's wrestling with his beliefs. IT'S NOT A TAKEDOWN PIECE meant to insult people of faith, NOR A FLUFF PIECE meant to prop up easy orthodoxies. The tone will match Dave's humble, thoughtful, yet challenging style as it explores the journey from faithfulness to unbelief. We'll dig into all the doubt in-between without an axe to grind. We're interested in the COMPLICATED BEAUTY OF ALL THE GRAYS OF LIFE at a time when black and white answers feel fleeting.
  Thus far we've worked on a shoestring, with the generous support of Fork Films, Barsuk Records and few key individuals who know this film is something really special. But now it’s time for us to lock ourselves in a room and turn all this incredible footage into a film.  
WE ARE LOOKING TO RAISE 75K (at least!). This is the bare minimum amount necessary to get us to a festival cut of the film with editing, composing, mixing, color correcting, and any additional photography we discover we need in the process. If we exceed our goal we will have more freedom and time to achieve the best version of this film. We will also be able to invest in the crucial marketing and PR necessary to get the word out.
We've partnered with Palaceworks, & Scraplabs to create some amazing exclusive perks for you. We're incredibly grateful for their involvement. We think you'll be excited about what they've come up with. Thanks also to Ryan Russell for the use of some of his images.
Lastly, YOU are essential to this process. As fans of Dave Bazan you know all the ways he and his music have impacted your life. We’re looking to amplify his message exponentially, and we can’t do that without your support. Please SPREAD THE WORD far and wide and follow us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter. You can also sign up for our official mailing list at bazanfilm.com
Please don't hesitate to reach out to us with any questions. We are very excited to be on this journey with you!
WE ARE:
BRANDON VEDDER: DIRECTOR
 Brandon Vedder is an award winning documentary filmmaker. His career began touring with and making films about musicians. His first release was the concert film PEARL JAM: LIVE AT THE GARDEN. In 2013 Brandon produced, edited and shot the acclaimed documentary LA SOURCE, narrated by Academy Award nominated actor, Don Cheadle. The award winning film had its world premiere at AFI Docs and went on to play theatrically in NYC & LA. In 2015 Brandon directed, shot & edited A CERTAIN KIND OF LIGHT, a documentary short that received six best short documentary awards and airs on PBS in early 2017. Brandon’s most recent release IN PURSUIT OF SILENCE, premiered at SXSW in 2016, and also played at CPH:DOX, Full Frame, Sheffield Doc Fest, Rooftop Films & Ashland Film Festivals. The film had an international theatrical release in late 2016 through The Cinema Guild and RO*CO films. Brandon is currently a fellow with the San Francisco Film Society where he has a year long filmmakers residency for STRANGE NEGOTIATIONS.
PRODUCER: ALISON MO MASSEY
Alison Mo Massey is a Creative Executive at Exhibit A Film, the minds behind KING OF KONG, UNDEFEATED and GLEASON. She co-produced FINDERS KEEPERS which premiered at the Sundance Film Festival in 2015 and sold to The Orchard, who released it in select theaters and on VOD. She is currently developing a range of projects in TV and features and documentary.

INSTRUCTIONS: To add-on an item to your pledge please follow the below steps:
1- Press the MANAGE PLEDGE button above - If you have not pledged yet it will say "Back this Project"
2 - Increase your pledge -  Adjust the total in the "pledge amount" box by the amount that corresponds with your add-ons
3 - Send us a message via Kickstarter indicating which add on items you would like.
4 - When the campaign is over you will receive a survey - At that time you will be able to indicate again which add-on items you would like, just to be sure we've noted it correctly.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Documentary Film is an art and not an exact science, and we may encounter setbacks along the way. It may take us longer to complete than anticipated, but given our experience making docs and our team of support including Fork Films, The San Francisco Film Society and The Film Collaborative we're confident that we will complete an amazing film.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Strange Negotiations streaming for free on Amazon Prime
updates.update_content:
Hello All, 
What an insane season it's been/continues to be since I last updated. I hope you've all been able to safely trudge through and am so sorry if that hasn't been the case. It's been so disheartening to watch many of the issues with the American church we explored in the film, supercharged and emboldened. Anyway, I'm feeling more hopeful than I have in months and we gotta hold on to those feelings when we get em. 

I've stayed very busy developing new projects during this lockdown. One of the projects I've been developing is a doc series that will spend some time with a different badass young musician/activist and their specific city/movement for each episode. Here is a playlist I've been adding to as I research: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/1ttLSimSZ9W4Z1HaB0D7kr?si=n9wIU-QFQma2U0EEwP4WRA

Hey All,
As we are all sheltering in place and likely exhausting our watchlists we wanted to shoot a reminder to either watch the film or share it if you haven't yet.  We have lowered the price as low as these platforms will let us go to try to remove any barriers in watching. 

The film is available for .99¢ rental on both iTunes and Vimeo. Both of these platforms have an app that allows you to watch on your TV home entertainment system. 

On iTunes you have 30 days to watch the film once you rent it so I'd suggest renting now to lock in the lower price.

Hey All!

Just wanted to shoot out a reminder to give the film a watch this weekend if you haven't yet!
I always feel weird about these reminders but I need to get over it because based on the numbers there are still many of you who haven't gotten a chance to watch yet and maybe a reminder isn't as annoying as I think.  

Very excited for you all to see it! Pick your favorite platform, turn the lights down and the volume up!

Feel free to FWD this email to anyone you think may dig the film as well.

Hope everyone is doing great,
Brandon

updates.update_userinfo: Streaming NOW & Note from our Director
updates.update_content:
WATCH NOW (US & Canada)
WATCH NOW (Rest of World)
I've learned more about myself, the world around me & the invisible one around us all during the making of this film than any other artistic pursuit in my life. Now that it's finally out in the world I'm hoping you'll find something you needed in it. 

Some of the early and to the film have bolstered my hope that this framing of David and his journey is compelling & helpful even outside any familiarity with him. It’s always been a priority to tell this story in a way that can resonate with anyone (your neighbor/parents/coworkers), Dave as us all…just better able to give words to our questions, feelings, and fears. 

I couldn’t be more proud of what the film has become and have total confidence in the watching experience once given a chance, but I've always known it was going to be a hard sell in terms of marketing and distribution. It, unfortunately, was never gonna be just this obvious, home-run that avalanched into general market interest…especially competing with so much worthy film/TV at our fingertips.

updates.update_userinfo: CHI, MINN & SEA Screenings THIS WEEKEND / iTunes RELEASE TUESDAY / Download Code Giveaway
updates.update_content:
We are finally getting there! This coming Tuesday I finally get to share this behemoth with you, this piece of art that all of you made possible. Actually I was asked about it in a recent interview and said this:   
Local Spins: Were there any specific moments or decisions that became a catalyst for the film’s success?
Brandon: The Kickstarter was a massive part. There was an incredible amount of support and love from this community that Dave has built. He has such a different relationship with his audience because most of the people who are diehard fans have been through a similar thing that he went through in telling his story. There’s so much emotional attachment and cognitive attachment on all these different levels. He was the voice in your ear when you were in the foxhole. It was amazing to see that whole crowd show up. There’s so many artists and writers and incredibly talented and creative people who became collaborators on the film because of the Kickstarter. Announcing it created this incredible groundswell and it gave me the latitude to stretch out and not make judgments before I had to.

campaign.story:
Update: SOLID SILVER COINS are now unlocked!! See 'Add-ons' below.
 Select 24K Gold Plated coins now available! See 'Add-ons' below.
What are Hobo Coins?
Throughout time, people have modified coins by hand-carving or engraving their own designs into existing coins. But this form of folk art really took off during the Great Depression. Those that were out of work or down on their luck took to modifying coins by engraving their own designs into them. They would use pocket knives or even filed down nails to carve beautiful designs that were as varied as the artists themselves. Often, these coins would portray skeletons or skulls, incorporating elements from the coins as part of their final works of art. They would almost always keep the lettering on the coins.
The Hobo Coins project brings back this largely forgotten piece of American history. These coins are being minted by the oldest continuously operated private mint in the U.S. and are SOLID. They each weigh about the same as 5 US. quarters, and are a little larger than the size of a US Dollar coins (these coins are 39 mm). Die-struck with over 100 tons of pressure in solid metal alloys and featuring antique finishes. Please note that Hobo Coins are not actual US currency or modified US currency coins, they are die-struck new coins at different sizes, weights, and (clearly), different art than actual US coins.
Help revive a piece of history you can carry!
The Designs
Each coin was crafted and designed by me using some of the most iconic coins as their base:
The ‘R.I.P.’ - 1922 Peace Dollar
Arguably the most beautiful coin ever produced, the U.S. Peace Dollar was originally produced to commemorate the peace that followed World War One. My rendition features a skull portrait (keeping the radiant crown) on the front (obverse), and two skeletal hands breaking a rifle on the back (reverse). Interesting to note that the ‘broken rifle’ was abstracted into the Peace Symbol we know today. Rest in Peace! Aged with an antique silver-finish. As with all the coins, this is a 39mm die-struck, hefty 12 gauge coin. Also, this coin will have a 'reeded' edge like the original Peace Dollar.
The 'R.I.P. Dollar - actual coin finish may vary.
The ‘Bad Mojo’ - 1936 Buffalo Nickel
My take on the classic Buffalo Nickel hobo coin (popular because it was a ‘soft’ coin to carve), features a skeleton Chief with a no-nonsense attitude on the front, and an intricately carved buffalo skeleton on the back. Aged with an antique silver-finish. As with all the coins, this is a 39mm die-struck, hefty 12 gauge coin. This coin will have a 'flat' edge like the original Buffalo Nickel.
The 'Bad Mojo' - actual coin finish may vary.
The ‘Walking Reaper’ - 1936 Walking Liberty Half Dollar
Scares the sh*t outta me—and that’s a good thing! Based on what is considered one the most beautiful coins of all time, the Walking Liberty Half Dollar. Front side (obverse) features a grim reaper you never want to meet, and the back of the coin shows a Poe-esque scene with a raven. Nevermore! Aged with an antique silver-finish. As with all the coins, this is a 39mm die-struck, hefty 12 gauge coin. This coin will have a 'reeded' edge like the original Walking Liberty Half Dollar.
The 'Walking Reaper' - actual coin finish may vary.
The ‘Old Hobo’ - 1891 Morgan Dollar
Even hobos like a drink! The front face (obverse) of the coin features a hobo skeleton enjoying a pint. The back side (reverse) shows a skeleton hobo chilling in a box car with his loyal dog companion. Aged with an antique silver-finish. As with all the coins, this is a 39mm die-struck, hefty 12 gauge coin. This coin will have a 'reeded' edge like the original Morgan Dollar.
The 'Old Hobo' - actual coin finish may vary.
The ‘Hobo Coin / Hobo Signs’ Limited Edition Print
To compliment the coins, I’ve designed this print which features a hobo walking through a shanty town along railroad tracks carrying a gunny sack, and is emblazoned with 'Liberty' at the top. Each print is 18” x 24”, signed, and numbered.
'Liberty' - inspired by coin typography and hobo coin art, each 18" x 24" print will be signed and numbered.
Add-ons
Additional coins or posters can be added to any base pledge as needed. Simply click on ‘Manage My Pledge’ and manually increase your pledge amount by the following:
Coins - add $14 (in the US), 15$ (international) to your pledge amount per additional coin, feel free to add as many as you would like. After the project closes you’ll be able to specify which design(s) you’d like.
Limited Edition Prints - add $40 (in the US), $46 (international) to your pledge amount per print.
Solid Silver Coins - add $60 ($65 international) to your pledge amount per solid silver coin. These coins are one troy ounce of solid .999 fine silver and will come with a Certificate of Authenticity card that is signed and numbered. The final quantity will be determined by the number ordered, feel free to add as many as you'd like. 
To add items to your pledge: Manually increase your pledge amount by the cost of the add-on items. After the project closes, I'll send you a link to make your final selections. For now, just click "Manage My Pledge" and add on the amount of your coin or print add-ons.
Here's a quick video on how to do this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ak8SWlMeIoo&app=desktop
And here are some pictures of the coins:
One Troy Ounce Solid Fine Silver Coins (.999)
  Back of the solid silver RIP
  One Troy Ounce Solid Fine Silver Coins (.999)
  Back of the solid silver Bad Mojo
  One Troy Ounce Solid Fine Silver Coins (.999)
  Back of the solid silver Walking Reaper
  One Troy Ounce Solid Fine Silver Coins (.999)
  Back of the solid silver Old Hobo
Select 24K Gold Plated Coins add $25 ($30 international) to your pledge amount per selective plated coin. These coins are nickel silver coins that are selectively plated with 24K gold. Same size and weight as all the other coins; please note that the base coin is not solid silver but is actually a nickel silver alloy. 
              Four Coin Display - add $15 ($20 international) to your pledge amount per display (each display hold four coins). A great way to show off your coins! Comprised of 3 acrylic panes with embedded magnets, this is a simple, elegant, and easy to open and close system for displaying Hobo Coins. 
Acrylic Hobo Coin Display
  3 panel system with embedded magnets for easy opening and closing.
Stretch Goals
Funded to $10,000 - UNLOCKED!!!!
Antique Bronze versions of all coins. You can now select Antique Bronze coins for any of the coins you've backed for, or add these coins to your existing pledge. You'll be able to select which coin finish you want for all your coins after the project closes.
Antique Bronze Stretch Goal Coins
Funded to $15,000 - UNLOCKED!!!! 
Antique Solid Copper versions of all coins. You can now select Antique Copper coins for any of the coins you've backed for, or add these coins to your existing pledge. You'll be able to select which coin finish you want for all your coins after the project closes.
Antique Copper Stretch Goal Coins
Funded to $20,000 - UNLOCKED!!!! 
Antique Brass-Plated Steel (works with magnets! These are actually a shade thinner than the other coins - 10 gauge, that's the only option available from the mint). You can now select Brass-Plated Steel coins for any of the coins you've backed for, or add these coins to your existing pledge. You'll be able to select which coin finish you want for all your coins after the project closes.
Antique Brass Plated Steel Stretch Goal Coins

Solid Silver Coins - UNLOCKED!!!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've created 3 fairly successful Kickstarter campaigns in the past - so I know there are always curveballs that challenge the best of plans. However, I feel super confident about this project. I've worked with the company who's making the coins and know their turnaround time, I've shipped thousands of coins to every corner of the world and know the complexities involved, and I've made good on every project in the past. My biggest watchouts for Hobo Coins are the finishes (gotta get that right), and the shipping timeframe. I put the estimated delivery as two months after the project closes and that's about right. If the project gets big (I should be so lucky), that might push out the delivery a little, but not much.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey everyone, the funding period for Hobo Coins just closed, and I can’t believe how well the project has done! I honestly launched not knowing what to expect since this was my first coin-only project. It surpassed even my most optimistic hopes! You guys are amazing!
Next Steps

If you get a note from Kickstarter saying there was a problem with your pledge funding, try to get that cleared up (mostly that's not a big deal, KS tries to pull your pledge for a couple of days). campaign.story:
TURA! THE TURA SATANA ADVANCE DOCUMENTARY TRAILER
THANK YOU TO OVER 730 KICKSTARTER BACKERS FOR A VERY SUCCESSFUL CAMPAIGN! THANK YOU, PUSSYCATS!
TURA! THANKS YOU!
INTERVIEW CLIPS
DITA VON TEESE CALLS YOU TO ACTION! Tura's sacrifices helped pave the way for Dita's career, and those of so many others. Don't hesitate, pledge now to this informative, inspiring documentary.  
 The legendary JOHN WATERS reveals how he and DIVINE discovered TURA SATANA as teenagers at the local drive-in!
 DENNIS BUSCH - FASTER, PUSSYCAT! KILL! KILL!
GRINDHOUSE LEGEND TED V. MIKELS TALKS TURA!
 THANK YOU! TOGETHER WE REACHED THE GOAL! VIVA SATANA!
“TURA!” is the true life story of cult movie icon & burlesque dancer TURA SATANA, chopped straight from the pages of her handwritten memoir. Best known as the star of Russ Meyer’s classic film Faster, Pussycat! Kill! Kill!, Tura stunned 1960’s movie audiences as the sexy, dominant, fast-driving, karate-wielding lesbian gang leader Varla. Her groundbreaking look, attitude, and performance were all years ahead of their time and continue to influence everyone from Quentin Tarantino and Rob Zombie to John Waters and Dita Von Teese. 
Still, Tura's screen life was nothing compared to her real life. As a child, Tura was imprisoned at Japanese American WWII internment camp Manzanar. As a pre-teen, she was the victim of a brutal, racially-motivated gang rape. But instead of letting those early tragedies destroy her, Tura flipped it around, reinventing herself into a world famous burlesque dancer, Asian American cinema hero, and most importantly, the living definition of female self-empowerment.
Featuring incredible new interviews with John Waters, Dita Von Teese & more, and narrated by Margaret Cho, TURA! will be a fascinating, thrilling white-knuckle ride through the life and career of one of the most infamous “bad girls” in cinema history. TURA! also serves to finally place Tura Satana alongside Bruce Lee in the pantheon of the most influential Asian American performers the world has ever known.
The production of this film was Tura Satana’s deathbed wish. Help her, and us, make it a reality. TURA! -- Just do it!
(This film is the AUTHORIZED DOCUMENTARY Tura Satana personally initiated prior to her death, being produced by her estate and closest friends).
SEE THE NEW INDIEWIRE ARTICLE HERE!
Despite her underground popularity and huge internet presence, Tura’s accomplishments and vast influence remain largely unrecognized. Tura fought long and hard for gains that others have since reaped the benefits from. It’s time to set the story straight! Tura didn’t just ‘open the door’ for modern Hollywood’s dominant leading ladies, she literally kicked that hole through the wall, blazing the path for others to follow. She deserves acknowledgement for that, and this film – created by those who knew and worked with her – gives her the respect and recognition she is long overdue. Tura’s “If I can do this, anyone can” attitude has inspired countless people in the past, and can now go on to inspire even more!
Once the film is completed (we estimate a year or less), we will use all of the means at our disposal to find the best possible release and distribution for the film. That includes screening at key festivals, distributor screenings, and inclusion at international film markets. We are very confident that the film will find wide release platforms, so all of our work will be shared with the world.
TURA! The Tura Satana Documentary
Starring: TURA SATANA   Narrated by MARGARET CHO 
Featuring Interviews with: 
JOHN WATERS - Writer/Director, Hairspray, Pink Flamingos  DITA VON TEESE - Burlesque Star, Fashion Designer  MARGARET CHO - Actor, Comedian  KITTEN NATIVIDAD - Beneath The Valley of the Ultra-Vixens  SHANNON LEE - Producer, Daughter of Bruce Lee  DAVID HENRY HWANG - Playwright, M. Butterfly  ALLISON ANDERS - Director, Mi Vida Loca, Four Rooms . TED V. MIKELS - Director, Astro-Zombies, Doll Squad, Corpse Grinders  LORI WILLIAMS - Actor, Faster, Pussycat! Kill! Kill!  DENNIS BUSCH - Actor, Faster, Pussycat! Kill! Kill!  PAMELA DES BARRES - Author  SELENE LUNA - The Cho Show  ERIC CHARMELO - Writer/Producer, Supernatural, Ringer  Plus more all the time!
THE TURA! CAST & CREW THANK YOU!
  Cody Jarrett/Director, Producer
Cody Jarrett is a Los Angeles-based director, writer and producer. Initially a musician and actor whose Hollywood film career began with a role in 20th Century Fox’s The Adventures of Ford Fairlane, Cody’s feature directing credits include SUGAR BOXX (Showtime Networks, Entertainment One) and FROG-G-G! (Koch Distribution). SUGAR BOXX was also Tura Satana's last film as an actress prior to her death.
Siouxzan Perry/Producer
Siouxzan was Tura’s long-time personal manager and confidant, as well as manager of numerous other “Russ Meyer” women. Siouxzan was granted all rights to Tura’s entertainment estate, likeness, and image upon Tura’s passing. She also possesses literally thousands of Tura’s belongings, including pictures, personal items, home movies, and more. Siouxzan is committed to Tura’s final wish of seeing this documentary produced.
YOMYOMF FOUNDATION/Executive Producer
YOMYOMF was founded by film director Justin Lin (FAST & FURIOUS franchise, STAR TREK BEYOND) to support Asian American artists who wish to pursue careers in film, TV, theater and new media and to create opportunities and develop audiences for projects by and/or about Asian Pacific Americans within the larger context of our multicultural society. Recent projects include the Interpretations Film Initiative to find emerging filmmakers (in partnership with Comcast and NBCU) and the relaunch of YOMYOMF 2.0 to serve as a hub for Asian American pop culture. 
Tura Thursday--a weekly feature on Tura Satana--is a part of YOMYOMF 2.0 and producer Philip W. Chung is overseeing the TURA! doc for YOMYOMF. See it here: http://www.yomyomf.com/
Helen Macfarlane/Associate Producer
NZ born, UK raised, lived and worked in Austria for 25 years, resident of California since 2011, Helen is a multi-media artist and linguist. She founded and ran a language, culture and media centre, theatre group and exhibitions in Salzburg Austria for over 20 years. For six years, she has worked with Siouxzan on this film, Tura Satana art shows and Tura’s personal estate.
TURA! needs Kickstarter! Your participation in this extremely worthwhile project allows this film to finish and fulfill its true potential: poignant and inspirational, harrowing and thrilling, sexy and ENTERTAINING! (It is a movie, after all). Join us! 
Plus, the perks/awards in this campaign are nothing short of spectacular. Tura Satana collectibles are valuable anyway, but the one-of-a-kind/one-time-only items being released for this campaign will blow your mind! Not to mention access to the filmmakers and like-minded backers at screenings, parties and even in the film's physical production. If you’re a cinema buff, this is the jackpot. 
Any amount you pledge will be directly reflected on screen, and you’ll be proud to be on board! Budget breakdowns are as follows:
    $50,000! WE ARE FUNDED and the amazing story of TURA SATANA becomes a reality for all of us, and goes out into the world to inspire people everywhere.
$60,000! YOU DID FIND IT HERE, COLUMBUS! This level of funding allows us to do something very special: visit and film at the locations where the milestones in Tura's life actually occurred. These powerful images would take the film to an entirely new level. BACKERS GET A TBD COOL SPECIAL AWARD.
$70,000 AND ABOVE! BIGGER, BADDER, FASTER, PUSSYCAT! Here it gets really fun! Allows us to shoot segments of the movie in SUPER 8 or SUPER 16mm FILM, adding an organic, period-authentic feel when it counts the most! BACKERS GET AN EVEN COOLER SPECIAL AWARD! (It's Tura, we'll pick something amazing!)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Making a film like this (independent documentary) has risks, many of which have already been taken on by the filmmakers. We've invested more than three years of time and our own money to get this off the ground. If this film were not finished & released, it would be both a financial blow and a loss of the time and effort spent by the crew and our amazing interview subjects. But this is something we believe in very strongly, so were willing to take on the risk in the interest of getting Tura's story told.
 
However, the risk in not completing this film goes beyond financial... 

We’ve already captured moving, indepth, sometimes hilarious interviews- 

JOHN WATERS recalling his discovery of TURA, and being so excited he brought DIVINE with him to the next show… DENNIS BUSCH on working with Tura and RUSS MEYER in the Mojave Desert on Faster, Pussycat! Kill! Kill!... TED V. MIKELS discussing his decades of Tura… the impact DITA VON TEESE felt when seeing Tura for the first time, and more. 

Many of these deeply personal memories and feelings have NEVER BEEN REVEALED BEFORE; gleams of personality and cinema history that will FALL AWAY, FORGOTTEN unless this film reaches its goal. Losing these touching, informative moments and breaking our final promise to Tura is the biggest risk of all, and something we can't let happen!

The Challenge

The depth and breadth of Tura Satana's life experiences could fill ten films. Tura “brings a lot to the table.” The challenge here is not so much production delays (as this is a documentary), but rather choosing which of the many the impactful, meaningful events go into the film. No easy task! We're not just "glossing over" Tura's looks and career; her real life was much more harrowing than any movie script could be.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
TURA!

Tura Satana Documentary Update

Good morning, good evening, good day to all members of Team Tura around the world!

First and foremost, we hope and trust each of you and your families are safe and healthy during this unparalleled time. We know it is far more challenging for some than others, depending on your geography, and our hearts are with you wherever you may be.

As for TURA! filming: health and safety concerns, as well as Los Angeles stay at home orders, have forced us to postpone the few final pieces that were scheduled to be filmed in April. However, parts of the post production process that do not involve person to person contact continue to move into finalization! And we are confident that as the pandemic passes, and it is safe to resume activities, TURA! will be flying out of the gate, as she has been waiting to do, engine revving!  Thank you again for all of your ongoing support. We are all contributors to a film you will be very, very proud of.

Come on, catch up with team Tura!
A HUGE thank you for the masses of fabulous birthday wishes for Tura on July 10th! Her birthday month is always full of love and great creativity, illustrated by the small selection of birthday wishes on Instagram further on in our letter.
TURA! Director, Cody Jarrett

Hey Pussycats!
During the month since Tura's birthday, we have been busy arranging interviews and other important documentary issues. In fact, Cody is  on the road with the crew filming interviews this very weekend  so there will be more news on his return!
Back at the ranch, we are all still working with the logistics of producing some of the perks and how to get you them in the best, most cost effective way, especially as many of you pledged for more than one! Just to clear the air, as we hear some loud foot-tapping going on in the background (understandably), we have to actually produce some of the perks  such as the crew shirt. We wrote on each perk that the deadline for fulfilling them is March 2018 due to film production, however, we will send out the available perks as soon as we have all the sizes for the crew shirts.
